results.title: Mao Tse Tung
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films, David L. Wolper and Alan Landsburg
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biography”.
Traces Mao Tse Tung’s life from his birth in Hunan Province, 1893, to becoming leader of Communist China. In 1920 he set out to gain control of China, in 1949 he proclaimed the birth of the communist regime in China. Shows how he gained leadership, banished Chiang Kai-Shek and his armies from the mainland, fought the U.N. forces to a stalemate on the 38th parallel, and presented a challenge to the western world. Narrated by Mike Wallace.
results.creator_credit_for_label: McGraw-Hill Films, David L. Wolper and Alan Landsburg

results.title: Mao's new suit
results.brief_description: Sally Ingleton’s documentary charts the fortunes of best friends Sun Jian and Guo Pei, as they prepare to stage their first designer collection in Shanghais annual Fashion Week. Their timing could not be more auspicious, Maoist austerity, the iron rice bowl and blue or grey tunics are out. For those too young to remember the Cultural Revolution, workers demonstrations have given way to makeup demonstrations. Matchmaking programs on TV and personal consultants are all the rage. This intriguing film captures the whirlwind pace of change in todays China.

results.title: Mao's China
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, Joe Schlesinger and Jessie Nishihata
results.brief_description: Chairman Mao’s thoughts provide the basis for a generalized explanation of Chinese society. Using Peking, Shanghai and Tientsin as examples, shows street scenes, a housing estate and a commune. Stresses the value of manual labour and the control of society by the people. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 9 (A)
results.creator_credit: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Cleaning up the house; words for ‘slow’ and ‘fast’; pram magic; reading “The Emu and the Crane”, a traditional story about how the emu lost its wings; working at the clinic; words for ‘North’, ‘South’, ‘East’ and ‘West’; song about making playing humpies in a creek bed; making spinifex resin; maths: 5-2=3, using eggs. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 8 (A)
results.creator_credit: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Planting trees; reading of “The Bird and the Snake”, a story from Willowra; words for ‘few’ and ‘many’, using children onn the Willowra school bus; tracking, spearing and cookking kangaroo; bathing, working at the butcher’s; numbers and counting; traditional-style dance about the Easter story; chips magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 7 (A)
results.creator_credit: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episodes covers the following topics: Magic story; school children at Willowra planting seeds for a vegetable garden; dog magic; reading of a dreamtime story, “The Crimson Cat, the Bird with a Red Breast”; words for ‘in’, ‘on’ and ‘under’; tracking a person by their footprints; song about children from local communities having fun; making a healthy stew; working at Nyirrpi store; basketball teams. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 6 (A)
results.creator_credit: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Golf magic; words for ‘first’ and ‘last” reading of “The Emu is looking for water’; story about bush medicine from ghost gum; dreaming story about country around Vaughan Springs; working as an administrative assistant at the school; making a sling-shot for getting birds; school children on a visit to the country of their dreamings, digging for rabbits, traditional dancing and singing about the country. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda

results.title: Manyu-Wana 5 (A)
results.creator_credit: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Holly magic; words for ‘happy’ and ‘serious’; reading of a “Story about Echidnas”’ number 8; story about a bush potato dreaming place; more on numbers, using doll magic; dreaming stories about places southwest of Yuendumu; boys and girls painted up and doing fire-dreaming dances; good food; bush animals, vegetables, fruits and seeds; working at the shop; bike magic. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.

results.title: Manyu-Wana 4 (A)
results.creator_credit: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Magic; spear-straightening in a fire and hunting for kangaroo; baby magic; words for ‘big’ and ‘little’ using different clothes being washed; collecting red ochre form a cave at Karrku, near Nyirrpi; working at the powerhouse; picking up rubbish; reading of “The Snake and the Goanna”; band magic; Nyirrpi tractor. Suitable for Primary, Secondary and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda

results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Manyu-Wana (A)”.
This episode covers the following topics: Children playing; dampers magic-number 6; exercising for health, showing football and basketball matches between communitites; spear-throwing at Yuendumu Sports; reading of “The Story about the Snake and the Mouse”; words for ‘heavy’ and ‘light’; colours; cleaning and grinding of bush seeds for seed cakes. Suitable for Primary, seconday and Tertiary level students. In Warlpiri language with Englsih subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warlpiri Media, David Batty and Wendy Baarda
